Protocols/LED_Element.html#/s:19RVS_Retr.name: drawingSize
Protocols/LED_Element.html#/s:19RVS_Retr.abstract: Get the drawing size of this element (or set of elements).

Protocols/LED_Element.html#/s:19RVS_Retr.name: value
Protocols/LED_Element.html#/s:19RVS_Retr.abstract: This is the value that is assigned to the element (or set of elements).

Protocols/LED_Element.html#/s:19RVS_Retr.name: numberOfDigits
Protocols/LED_Element.html#/s:19RVS_Retr.abstract: This is the number of digits, represented by this instance.

Protocols/LED_Element.html#/s:19RVS_Retr.name: idealAspect
Protocols/LED_Element.html#/s:19RVS_Retr.abstract: The ideal aspect ratio (X / Y) of the display.

Protocols/LED_Element.html.name: LED_Element
Protocols/LED_Element.html.abstract: This protocol specifies the interface for an element that is to be incorporated into an LED display group.

Extensions/CGPoint.html#/s:So7CGPointV19.name: _rotated(around:byDegrees:)
Extensions/CGPoint.html#/s:So7CGPointV19.abstract: Rotate this point around a given point, by an angle given in degrees.

Extensions/BinaryInteger.html#/s:Sz19RVS.name: digits
Extensions/BinaryInteger.html#/s:Sz19RVS.abstract: Returns an array of integers; each representing the numerical value of the integer, as a decimal number (0…9).

Extensions/BinaryInteger.html#/s:Sz19RVS.name: hexDigits
Extensions/BinaryInteger.html#/s:Sz19RVS.abstract: Returns an array of integers; each representing the numerical value of the integer, as a hexadecimal number (0…F).

Extensions/UIImage.html#/s:So7UIImageC19.name: resized(toScaleFactor:)
Extensions/UIImage.html#/s:So7UIImageC19.abstract: This allows an image to be resized, given a maximum dimension, and a scale will be determined to meet that dimension.

Extensions/UIImage.html#/s:So7UIImageC19.name: resized(toNewWidth:toNewHeight:)
Extensions/UIImage.html#/s:So7UIImageC19.abstract: This allows an image to be resized, given both a width and a height, or just one of the dimensions.

Classes/RVS_RetroLEDDigitalDisplay.html#.name: _digitFactory
Classes/RVS_RetroLEDDigitalDisplay.html#.abstract: This holds the instance that will generate the paths we use for display.

Classes/RVS_RetroLEDDigitalDisplay.html#.name: _originalBackgroundColor
Classes/RVS_RetroLEDDigitalDisplay.html#.abstract: This caches the original background color. It is set at load time.

Classes/RVS_RetroLEDDigitalDisplay.html#.name: _originalTintColor
Classes/RVS_RetroLEDDigitalDisplay.html#.abstract: This caches the original tint color. It is set at load time.

Classes/RVS_RetroLEDDigitalDisplay.html#.name: _onColorLayer
Classes/RVS_RetroLEDDigitalDisplay.html#.abstract: This caches the gradient layer for the “On” segments. This is set when the gradient is redrawn.

Classes/RVS_RetroLEDDigitalDisplay.html#.name: _onGradientStartColor
Classes/RVS_RetroLEDDigitalDisplay.html#.abstract: The starting color for the gradient.

Classes/RVS_RetroLEDDigitalDisplay.html#.name: _onGradientEndColor
Classes/RVS_RetroLEDDigitalDisplay.html#.abstract: The ending color.

Classes/RVS_RetroLEDDigitalDisplay.html#.name: _onGradientAngleInDegrees
Classes/RVS_RetroLEDDigitalDisplay.html#.abstract: The angle of the gradient, in degrees.

Classes/RVS_RetroLEDDigitalDisplay.html#.name: _offColorLayer
Classes/RVS_RetroLEDDigitalDisplay.html#.abstract: This caches the gradient layer for the “Off” segments. This is set when the gradient is redrawn.

Classes/RVS_RetroLEDDigitalDisplay.html#.name: _offGradientStartColor
Classes/RVS_RetroLEDDigitalDisplay.html#.abstract: The starting color for the gradient.

Classes/RVS_RetroLEDDigitalDisplay.html#.name: _offGradientEndColor
Classes/RVS_RetroLEDDigitalDisplay.html#.abstract: The ending color.

Classes/RVS_RetroLEDDigitalDisplay.html#.name: _offGradientAngleInDegrees
Classes/RVS_RetroLEDDigitalDisplay.html#.abstract: The angle of the gradient, in degrees.

Classes/RVS_RetroLEDDigitalDisplay.html#.name: _ledPathMaker
Classes/RVS_RetroLEDDigitalDisplay.html#.abstract: This is the LED digit[s] that is|are used to produce the bezier paths for this display.

Classes/RVS_RetroLEDDigitalDisplay.html#.name: _onImage
Classes/RVS_RetroLEDDigitalDisplay.html#.abstract: This image, if provided, will be used instead of a gradient, for the “active” LED segments.

Classes/RVS_RetroLEDDigitalDisplay.html#.name: _makeOnColorLayer()
Classes/RVS_RetroLEDDigitalDisplay.html#.abstract: This creates the “On” gradient/image layer, using our specified start and stop colors.

Classes/RVS_RetroLEDDigitalDisplay.html#.name: _makeOffColorLayer()
Classes/RVS_RetroLEDDigitalDisplay.html#.abstract: This creates the “Off” gradient/image layer, using our specified start and stop colors.

Classes/RVS_RetroLEDDigitalDisplay.html#.name: onGradientStartColor
Classes/RVS_RetroLEDDigitalDisplay.html#.abstract: The starting color for the “On” gradient.

Classes/RVS_RetroLEDDigitalDisplay.html#.name: onGradientEndColor
Classes/RVS_RetroLEDDigitalDisplay.html#.abstract: The ending color. If not provided, then the starting color is used.

Classes/RVS_RetroLEDDigitalDisplay.html#.name: onGradientAngleInDegrees
Classes/RVS_RetroLEDDigitalDisplay.html#.abstract: The angle of the gradient, in degrees. 0 (default) is top-to-bottom.

Classes/RVS_RetroLEDDigitalDisplay.html#.name: offGradientStartColor
Classes/RVS_RetroLEDDigitalDisplay.html#.abstract: The starting color for the “Off” gradient.

Classes/RVS_RetroLEDDigitalDisplay.html#.name: offGradientEndColor
Classes/RVS_RetroLEDDigitalDisplay.html#.abstract: The ending color. If not provided, then the starting color is used.

Classes/RVS_RetroLEDDigitalDisplay.html#.name: offGradientAngleInDegrees
Classes/RVS_RetroLEDDigitalDisplay.html#.abstract: The angle of the gradient, in degrees. 0 (default) is top-to-bottom.

Classes/RVS_RetroLEDDigitalDisplay.html#.name: numberOfDigits
Classes/RVS_RetroLEDDigitalDisplay.html#.abstract: This is the number of digits for this group. 0 (or less), means no display.

Classes/RVS_RetroLEDDigitalDisplay.html#.name: gap
Classes/RVS_RetroLEDDigitalDisplay.html#.abstract: This is how many calculation (not display) units separate each digit. Default is 8.

Classes/RVS_RetroLEDDigitalDisplay.html#.name: onImage
Classes/RVS_RetroLEDDigitalDisplay.html#.abstract: This property allows you to assign an image to the on segments.

Classes/RVS_RetroLEDDigitalDisplay.html#.name: value
Classes/RVS_RetroLEDDigitalDisplay.html#.abstract: This is a numerical value to set to the collected digits.

Classes/RVS_RetroLEDDigitalDisplay.html#.name: minValue
Classes/RVS_RetroLEDDigitalDisplay.html#.abstract: Read-only value that returns the minimum possible value for this instance (always -2).

Classes/RVS_RetroLEDDigitalDisplay.html#.name: maxValue
Classes/RVS_RetroLEDDigitalDisplay.html#.abstract: Read-only value that returns the maximum possible value for this instance.

Classes/RVS_RetroLEDDigitalDisplay.html#.name: image
Classes/RVS_RetroLEDDigitalDisplay.html#.abstract: This property allows you to assign an image to the off segments.

Classes/RVS_RetroLEDDigitalDisplay.html#.name: layoutSubviews()
Classes/RVS_RetroLEDDigitalDisplay.html#.abstract: Called when the views are to be laid out. Most of the action happens here.

Classes/LED_MultipleDigits.html#/s:19RVS.name: _digitArray
Classes/LED_MultipleDigits.html#/s:19RVS.abstract: This is a linear array of digits.

Classes/LED_MultipleDigits.html#/s:19RVS.name: gap
Classes/LED_MultipleDigits.html#/s:19RVS.abstract: This is how many calculation (not display) units separate each digit. Default is 10.

Classes/LED_MultipleDigits.html#/s:19RVS.name: drawingSize
Classes/LED_MultipleDigits.html#/s:19RVS.abstract: Get the drawing size of this set of elements.

Classes/LED_MultipleDigits.html#/s:19RVS.name: value
Classes/LED_MultipleDigits.html#/s:19RVS.abstract: This is the value that is assigned to the set of elements.

Classes/LED_MultipleDigits.html#/s:19RVS.name: numberOfDigits
Classes/LED_MultipleDigits.html#/s:19RVS.abstract: Returns the number of digits, represented by this array.

Classes/LED_SingleDigit/SegmentIndexes.h.name: SegmentIndexes
Classes/LED_SingleDigit/SegmentIndexes.h.abstract: These are indexes, used to make it a bit more apparent what segment is being sought.

Classes/LED_SingleDigit.html#/s:19RVS_Re.name: _c_g_segmentSelection
Classes/LED_SingleDigit.html#/s:19RVS_Re.abstract: These provide the indexes for selected values

Classes/LED_SingleDigit.html#/s:19RVS_Re.name: _c_g_StandardShapePoints
Classes/LED_SingleDigit.html#/s:19RVS_Re.abstract: This is an array of points that maps out the standard element shape.

Classes/LED_SingleDigit.html#/s:19RVS_Re.name: _c_g_CenterShapePoints
Classes/LED_SingleDigit.html#/s:19RVS_Re.abstract: This maps out the center element, which is a slightly different shape.

Classes/LED_SingleDigit.html#/s:19RVS_Re.name: _c_g_viewOffsets
Classes/LED_SingleDigit.html#/s:19RVS_Re.abstract: This array of points dictates the layout of the display.

Classes/LED_SingleDigit.html#/s:19RVS_Re.name: _c_g_displaySize
Classes/LED_SingleDigit.html#/s:19RVS_Re.abstract: This is the size of the entire drawing area.

Classes/LED_SingleDigit.html#/s:19RVS_Re.name: _topSegment
Classes/LED_SingleDigit.html#/s:19RVS_Re.abstract: The bezier path for the top segment

Classes/LED_SingleDigit.html#/s:19RVS_Re.name: _topLeftSegment
Classes/LED_SingleDigit.html#/s:19RVS_Re.abstract: The bezier path for the top, left segment

Classes/LED_SingleDigit.html#/s:19RVS_Re.name: _bottomLeftSegment
Classes/LED_SingleDigit.html#/s:19RVS_Re.abstract: The bezier path for the bottom, left segment

Classes/LED_SingleDigit.html#/s:19RVS_Re.name: _topRightSegment
Classes/LED_SingleDigit.html#/s:19RVS_Re.abstract: The bezier path for the top, right segment

Classes/LED_SingleDigit.html#/s:19RVS_Re.name: _bottomRightSegment
Classes/LED_SingleDigit.html#/s:19RVS_Re.abstract: The bezier path for the bottom, right segment

Classes/LED_SingleDigit.html#/s:19RVS_Re.name: _bottomSegment
Classes/LED_SingleDigit.html#/s:19RVS_Re.abstract: The bezier path for the bottom segment

Classes/LED_SingleDigit.html#/s:19RVS_Re.name: _centerSegment
Classes/LED_SingleDigit.html#/s:19RVS_Re.abstract: The bezier path for the center segment

Classes/LED_SingleDigit.html#/s:19RVS_Re.name: _value
Classes/LED_SingleDigit.html#/s:19RVS_Re.abstract: The value expressed by this instance -2…15

Classes/LED_SingleDigit.html#/s:19RVS_Re.name: init(_:)
Classes/LED_SingleDigit.html#/s:19RVS_Re.abstract: Instantiates each of the segments.

Classes/LED_SingleDigit.html#/s:19RVS_Re.name: _newSegmentShape(inSegment:)
Classes/LED_SingleDigit.html#/s:19RVS_Re.abstract: Creates a path containing a segment shape.

Classes/LED_SingleDigit.html#/s:19RVS_Re.name: _isSegmentSelected(_:)
Classes/LED_SingleDigit.html#/s:19RVS_Re.abstract: Returns true, if the segment is selected for the current value.

Classes/LED_SingleDigit.html#/s:19RVS_Re.name: allSegments
Classes/LED_SingleDigit.html#/s:19RVS_Re.abstract: Get all segments as one path.

Classes/LED_SingleDigit.html#/s:19RVS_Re.name: activeSegments
Classes/LED_SingleDigit.html#/s:19RVS_Re.abstract: Get “active” segments as one path.

Classes/LED_SingleDigit.html#/s:19RVS_Re.name: inactiveSegments
Classes/LED_SingleDigit.html#/s:19RVS_Re.abstract: Get “inactive” segments as one path.

Classes/LED_SingleDigit.html#/s:19RVS_Re.name: drawingSize
Classes/LED_SingleDigit.html#/s:19RVS_Re.abstract: Get the bounding box of this segment.

Classes/LED_SingleDigit.html#/s:19RVS_Re.name: value
Classes/LED_SingleDigit.html#/s:19RVS_Re.abstract: Public accessor for the value of this digit (-1 through 15).

Classes/LED_SingleDigit.html#/s:19RVS_Re.name: numberOfDigits
Classes/LED_SingleDigit.html#/s:19RVS_Re.abstract: This is the number of digits, represented by this instance.

Classes/LED_SingleDigit.html.name: LED_SingleDigit
Classes/LED_SingleDigit.html.abstract: This class represents a single LED digit.

Classes/LED_MultipleDigits.html.name: LED_MultipleDigits
Classes/LED_MultipleDigits.html.abstract: This aggregates multiple single digits, into a row of them, and treats the row as an MSB -> LSB hex value.

Classes/RVS_RetroLEDDigitalDisplay.html.name: RVS_RetroLEDDigitalDisplay
Classes/RVS_RetroLEDDigitalDisplay.html.abstract: The display is a subclass of UIImageView. We do this, so we can easily have a background image.
